clauses.body_md:
1.1 In this DPA:

**"Controller"**, **"Processor"**, **"Data Subject"**, **"Personal Data"**, **"Personal Data Breach"**, **"processing"** (and related terms), and **"Supervisory Authority"** have the meanings given to them in the UK GDPR.

**"Data Protection Legislation"** means:

(a) the UK GDPR and the Data Protection Act 2018 (and regulations made thereunder), as amended, superseded, or replaced from time to time;

(b) the Privacy and Electronic Communications (EC Directive) Regulations 2003 (PECR), as amended; and

(c) any other applicable UK law relating to the processing of Personal Data and privacy.

**"ICO"** means the UK Information Commissioner's Office.

**"UK GDPR"** means Regulation (EU) 2016/679 as it forms part of the law of England and Wales, Scotland, and Northern Ireland by virtue of section 3 of the European Union (Withdrawal) Act 2018 (and as amended by the Data Protection, Privacy and Electronic Communications (Amendments etc) (EU Exit) Regulations 2019).

**"Main Agreement"** means the agreement identified in the recitals to which this DPA is annexed or forms part.

**"Processing Details"** means the details of the processing operations set out in Schedule 1.

**"Security Measures"** means the technical and organisational security measures set out in Schedule 2.

**"International Data Transfer Addendum"** or **"IDTA"** means the International Data Transfer Addendum to the EU Commission Standard Contractual Clauses issued by the ICO under section 119A of the Data Protection Act 2018.

**"Standard Contractual Clauses"** or **"SCCs"** means:

(a) for transfers subject to UK GDPR: the IDTA or the EU Commission Standard Contractual Clauses (Decision 2021/914) as approved for use in the UK with the IDTA applied; or

(b) for transfers subject to EU GDPR (where this DPA also governs EU data): the EU Commission Standard Contractual Clauses (Decision 2021/914).

**"Sub-processor"** means any processor engaged by the Processor to process Personal Data on behalf of the Controller.

1.2 The terms **"controller"**, **"processor"**, **"data subject"**, **"personal data"**, **"personal data breach"**, and **"processing"** (and related terms) shall be interpreted in accordance with the UK GDPR and Data Protection Act 2018.

1.3 References to Articles of the GDPR shall be read as references to the corresponding provisions of the UK GDPR.

1.4 In the event of any conflict between this DPA and the Main Agreement, this DPA shall prevail to the extent of the conflict. In all other respects, the Main Agreement remains in full force and effect.

metadata.compliance_notes: UK-specific DPA compliant with UK GDPR and Data Protection Act 2018. Key points: (1) UK GDPR is the EU GDPR as retained in UK law post-Brexit with modifications; (2) ICO is the supervisory authority; (3) International Data Transfer Addendum (IDTA) must be used for transfers outside UK (replacing or supplementing EU SCCs); (4) UK adequacy decisions differ from EU (e.g., UK has granted adequacy to EU, but EU adequacy for UK is transitional); (5) Transfer Risk Assessments required per ICO guidance implementing Schrems II principles; (6) s.17A DPA 2018 governs adequacy decisions; s.119A DPA 2018 governs IDTA; (7) PECR applies to electronic marketing/cookies.
